algorithm_technique: Two-pointer approach using dummy nodes to build two separate lists (less than x, greater than or equal to x) and then merging them.
problem_summary_simple: Rearrange a linked list so all nodes less than x come before nodes greater than or equal to x.
problem_summary_technical: Maintain two separate linked lists for elements less than and greater than or equal to x, then concatenate.
key_insights: Using dummy nodes simplifies the handling of the head of the new lists.
The relative order within each partition is preserved by appending nodes sequentially.
The final step involves connecting the tail of the 'less than' list to the head of the 'greater than or equal to' list.
